greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Derived from a(n)=binomial(n+1,2) - sum{i=1,n-1,a(i)*floor(n/i)} (see A000010) - this is the value of the constant term.
comment: It is conjectured that a(n) is never less than 0 (tested to n=2000)
example: The formula produces the initial output:
The sequence gives the constant term.
program: (PARI) s=vector(200); t(n)=binomial(n+1,2); s[1]=x; for(i=2,200, s[i]=t(i)-sum(j=1,i-1, s[j]*floor(i/j))); for(i=1,200,print1(","polcoeff(s[i],0)))
results.author: _Jon Perry_, Mar 02 2004
